stimulusHtml: Assuming all conditions for inference are met, which of the following is a 95 percent confidence interval for the population mean biomass, in kg/m<sup>2</sup> ?

features.html: Ecologists wanted to estimate the mean biomass (amount of vegetation) of a certain forested region. The ecologists divided the region into plots measuring 1 square meter each, and they selected a random sample of 9 plots. The mean biomass of the 9 plots was 4.3 kilograms per square meter (kg/m<sup>2</sup>) and the standard deviation was 1.5 kg/m<sup>2</sup>.
